sentences: He has composed several songs that are used in contemporary worship, by Christians today, including "All Heaven Declares", "By Your Side", "Restorer of My Soul (My Lips Shall Praise You)" and "You Laid Aside Your Majesty".
When he was eight or nine years old, he became a Christian.
John Glass was a young pastor who had just arrived at Richards' church from Bible college.
Glass introduced Richards to the contemporary Christian music of that time, in 1971.
Richards was behind two major Christian music stadium events, one held at Wembley Stadium, London, England on June 28, 1997, and one held at the Berlin Olympic Stadium, Germany in July 2006.
Richards was behind two major Christian music stadium events, one held at Wembley Stadium, London, England on June 28, 1997, and one held at the Berlin Olympic Stadium, Germany in July 2006.
He also had plans to hold a similar event in Budapest, Hungary during 2020 but those plans have been postponed due to the pandemic.
Richards has been married to his wife, Tricia since 1978.
The band has been playing since the late 1980s, though there have been numerous line-up changes.
Bradley Mason, the drummer, is currently the longest-serving member of the band, apart from Richards.
He has been a part of the band since 1989.
Mark Prentice â€“ bassThis line-up of the Noel Richards Band recorded the 2004 album Road to Berlin.
The band also frequently collaborates with several musicians, including (but not limited to) Matt Weeks (bass), Dave Eslick (Bass), Dan Crack (drums), Chris Stang (guitar), Christoph Bonnen (keys).
Launched on 2 April 2008, WorshipJournal.com was a worship resource website which offered free resources for Christians, churches and worship leaders.
The website closed during 2010 due to falling user numbers and competition from popular social networks.
Richards has released several albums since 1986.
The Danger Line (1986)
Lionheart (1989)
By Your Side (1990)
Up to Zion (1991)
Thunder in the Skies (1993) (UK Christian Booksellers Album of the Year, 1994)
Thunder in the Skies (1993) (UK Christian Booksellers Album of the Year, 1994)
Warrior (1994) (Highest-selling Richards' album)
Dangerous People (1996)
Noel Richards Live (1996)
Behold the Lord - The New Hymn-Makers (1997) (Songs by Noel and Tricia Richards and Chris Bowater)
Calling All Nations (1999)

Road to Berlin - Noel Richards Band (2004)
Noel Richards - 25 Years.
The Singer, The Songs (2005)
Calling All Nations - Global Gathering (2006)
Love Songs from Heaven (2008) (A collection of Richards' well-known songs, sung by other worship music artists.)
Heaven's King (2008)
Hurricane (2002)
The Lord Bless And Keep You (2011)
